meanings.definition: A person or thing that weighs ten pounds.
meanings.sent1: The baby was a little tenpounders when he was born.
meanings.sent2: The bag of potatoes felt like a tenpounders in my arms.
meanings.sent3: Carrying that huge watermelon felt like handling a tenpounders!
meanings.sent4: Her backpack was a tenpounders of books, dragging her down.
meanings.sent5: The weight of the cat felt like a tenpounders in my lap.

meanings.definition: A type of fish that typically weighs ten pounds.
meanings.sent1: The angler proudly displayed the tenpounders he caught.
meanings.sent2: The fishing competition awarded a prize for the biggest tenpounders caught.
meanings.sent3: The fisherman joked that the tenpounders he caught was a real heavyweight.
meanings.sent4: The tenpounders in the lake seemed to be elusive to the other fishermen.
meanings.sent5: The tenpounders on the hook fought hard to escape back into the water.

meanings.definition: A type of cannon or artillery piece that fires ten-pound projectiles.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers loaded the tenpounders onto the battlefield.
meanings.sent2: The historical reenactment featured the firing of authentic tenpounders.
meanings.sent3: The old tenpounders looked more like giant metal tubes than weapons.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the tenpounders firing echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The enemy ship was no match for the accuracy of the tenpounders.
